column1: Nha Trang (; Vietnamese: [ɲaː˧ ʈaːŋ˧] (listen)) is a coastal city and capital of Khánh Hòa Province
column2: on the South Central Coast of Vietnam. It is bounded on the north by Ninh Hoà district
column3: on the south by Cam Ranh town and on the west by Diên Khánh District. The city has about 392
column4: 000 inhabitants
column5: a number that is projected to increase to 560
column7: 000 inhabitants by 2025. An area of 12.87 square kilometres (4.97 sq mi) of the western communes of Diên An and Diên Toàn is planned to be merged into Nha Trang which will make its new area 265.47 square kilometres (102.50 sq mi) based on the approval of the Prime Minister of Vietnam in September 2012.

column1: Nha Trang is well known for its beaches and scuba diving and has developed into a popular destination for international tourists
column2: attracting large numbers of backpackers
column3: as well as more affluent travelers on the south-east Asia circuit; it is already very popular with Vietnamese tourists
column4: with Nha Trang Bay widely considered as among the world's most beautiful bays. Tourists are welcomed to participate in the Sea Festival
column5: held biennially. Nha Trang was the site of the Miss Universe 2008 Pageant on July 14
column6: 2008 and Miss Earth 2010 was held on December 4
column7: 2010. It was also the site for the April 14
column8: 2015 season 8 finale of Face Off. Nha Trang was approved to host the 2016 Asian Beach Games.

column2: the city was known as Kauthara under rule of the Kingdom of Champa. The city is still home to the famous Po Nagar Tower built by the Champa. Being a coastal city
column3: Nha Trang is a centre for marine science based at the Nha Trang Oceanography Institute. The Hon Mun marine protected area is one of four first marine protected areas in the world admitted by the IUCN.

column2: the name Nha Trang derives from a Vietnamese spelling of the Cham language name of the site Ea Dran (literally "Reed River")
column3: the name of the Cai River as referred to by the Cham people. From the name of this river
column4: the name was adopted to call what is now Nha Trang
column5: which was officially made Vietnam's territory in 1698. Ea Dran is a common Cham and Montagnard place name

column1: Nha Trang city has a metropolitan area of 251 km² and population of about 500
column2: 000. It borders Ninh Hòa town in the north
column3: Cam Ranh city in the south
column4: Diên Khánh town in the west and the East Sea to the east. The city is on the beautiful Nha Trang Bay
column5: which was chosen by Travel + Leisure in two succeeding years as one of 29 most beautiful bays in the world. Nha Trang is surrounded on all three sides by mountains and a large island and four smaller ones on the fourth side (in the ocean directly in front of the city's main area)
column6: blocking major storms from potentially damaging the city.

column1: Nha Trang has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen climate classification: As) with a lengthy dry season from January to August and a shorter wet season from September to December
column2: when 1
column3: 029 millimetres (41 in) of the city's total annual rainfall of 1
column4: 361 millimetres (54 in) is received from the north-east monsoon. During the wet season extremely heavy rainfall from typhoons is not uncommon
column5: though the city is shielded from the worst winds.

column1: Nha Trang is home to the multidisciplinary Nha Trang University (formerly Nha Trang Fishery University); the Naval and Aviation Academy; a teacher's training college; Khanh Hoa University
column2: as well as the Nha Trang Oceanography Institute a unique institute of oceanography in Vietnam and the Pasteur Institute of Nha Trang
column3: one of the many famous Pasteur Institutes.

column2: discoverer of the Yersinia pestis bacterium lived in Nha Trang for 50 years and was affectionately known as Ông Năm. He established the Indochinese Pasteur Institute (now known as the Pasteur Institute of Nha Trang)
column3: devoted to researching the bubonic plague. Yersin died in Nha Trang on 1 March 1943. A street in the city is named after him
column4: and a shrine has been built over his tomb. There is a Yersin Museum dedicated to his achievements.

column1: Nha Trang's economy relies largely on tourism. In the suburban areas around the city
column2: the shipbuilding industry has developed and contributed significantly to the local economy. Fishery and services are also important to the city. Khánh Hòa Province in general and Nha Trang is particular are among the largest contributors to Vietnam's annual budget revenues. Lobster farming on the sea is an important industry for the people living in suburb areas.

column1: To the south of the city
column2: by Cam Ranh Bay
column3: several industrial parks are under construction and have been partly available for investors. Once the construction of the deep-water port on Vân Phong Bay has been completed
column4: this area will become the third important economic zone in the province (besides Nha Trang and Cam Ranh).

column1: Nha Trang is one of the most important tourist hubs of Vietnam
column2: thanks to its beaches with fine and clean sand and the clear ocean water with mild temperatures all year round. There are several resorts — such as Vinpearl
column3: Diamond Bay and Ana Mandara — and amusement and water parks
column4: in the city and on islands off the coast. The possibly most beautiful street of Nha Trang is Tran Phu Street along the seaside
column5: sometimes referred to as the Pacific Coast Highway of Vietnam.

column1: Lying off Nha Trang is the Hon Tre Island (Bamboo Island)
column2: with a major resort operated by the Vinpearl Group. The Vinpearl Cable Car
column3: a gondola lift system
column4: links the mainland to the five-star resort and theme park on Hon Tre Island.

column1: Nha Trang is a stopover for annual yacht races starting in Hong Kong. In recent years
column2: the city has welcomed many five-star sea cruises. In addition to sailboat racing
column3: Nha Trang provides a rich variety of tourist activities for visitors. Island hopping
column4: scuba diving
column5: water sports and other sporting activities can be enjoyed. The Nha Trang Tourist Information Center (a non-governmental organisation)
column6: located near the Cho Dam Market has been set up to provide information for visitors.The local cuisine is most famous for fresh seafood and barbecued pork rolled in rice paper. The area's bird's nest soup is deemed one of the best in Vietnam. Bird's nests are collected in the wild
column7: on bird farms on the islands off the coast and even in some houses in the inner city. The farmed bird in question belongs to the swiftlet group
column8: popularly referred to as yến hàng (Aerodramus fuciphagus and A. germani).

column1: When Cam Ranh Bay used to be an important naval base
column2: Nha Trang Airport was the main airport of the city. This airport was used by the United States Air Force and Republic of Vietnam Air Force during the Vietnam War. When part of Cam Ranh Bay was made an economic development zone by the Vietnamese government

column6: the airport has domestic connections to Hanoi
